drug.name: Crenolanib
drug.description: Crenolanib is under investigation for the treatment of Diffuse Intrinsic Pontine Glioma and Progressive or Refractory High-Grade Glioma.

classification.description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as aminoquinolines and derivatives. These are organic compounds containing an amino group attached to a quinoline ring system.

category.category: Receptor, Platelet-Derived Growth Factor alpha, antagonists & inhibitors
Receptor, Platelet-Derived Growth Factor beta, antagonists & inhibitors

drug-interaction.name: Darbepoetin alfa
drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of Thrombosis can be increased when Darbepoetin alfa is combined with Crenolanib.

drug-interaction.name: Erythropoietin
drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of Thrombosis can be increased when Erythropoietin is combined with Crenolanib.

drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of Thrombosis can be increased when Peginesatide is combined with Crenolanib.

drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of Thrombosis can be increased when Methoxy polyethylene glycol-epoetin beta is combined with Crenolanib.

drug-interaction.name: Acetaminophen
drug-interaction.description: The serum concentration of Acetaminophen can be increased when it is combined with Crenolanib.

drug-interaction.name: Propacetamol
drug-interaction.description: The serum concentration of Propacetamol can be increased when it is combined with Crenolanib.

drug-interaction.name: Salmon Calcitonin
drug-interaction.description: The therapeutic efficacy of Salmon Calcitonin can be decreased when used in combination with Crenolanib.
